questions.question: Gambling goes ........................... my principles.
questions.description: If something goes against your principles, you cannot agree with that.

questions.question: She has gone ...................... a lot of hardships.
questions.description: To go through something is to experience it.

questions.question: I will go ...................... these files if I get time.
questions.description: To go through something is to examine it carefully.

questions.question: Whether you give us your support or not we will go ......................
questions.description: To go ahead is to proceed.

questions.question: I think I am going ...................... with flu.
questions.description: To go down with flu is to become ill with it.

questions.question: Have we got enough food to go .....................?
questions.description: Go round  = have enough to serve everybody around

questions.question: We have gone a bit too far. Don't you think we should go ................... now?
questions.description: To go back is to return to a previous position.

questions.question: Although I hadn't provoked the dog, he went ....................... me.
questions.description: To go for somebody is to attack them.

questions.question: Don't forget to go ......................... your notes before exam.
questions.description: To go over notes is to revise them.

questions.question: Prices of essential commodities have gone .........................
questions.description: When prices go up, they increase.

questions.question: He went ........................ his family business as soon as he had completed his MBA.
James is going ......................... with a French girl.
questions.description: To go out with somebody is to have a romantic relationship with them.
